WorkItem.ClosedComment:
I'm aware of that, but it's non-trivial to retrieve the assembly name of the project that the designer is part of. It's possible, but I decided to leave it like that since (1) it is just a sample file and (2) the assembly name isn't required to be present in the configuration file (unless the project is strong-named if I'm not mistaken).

So unless you have a really compelling reason to go the extra mile for that sample file, I'm closing this issue - sorry.
WorkItem.Description: The name of the assembly where the configuration section can be found should be included in the sample configuration file.
WorkItem.Summary: Assembly name missing from sample configuration file

Comments.Message:
I'm aware of that, but it's non-trivial to retrieve the assembly name of the project that the designer is part of. It's possible, but I decided to leave it like that since (1) it is just a sample file and (2) the assembly name isn't required to be present in the configuration file (unless the project is strong-named if I'm not mistaken).

So unless you have a really compelling reason to go the extra mile for that sample file, I'm closing this issue - sorry.
